    Publications

    • Tractostorm 2: Optimizing tractography dissection reproducibility with segmentation protocol dissemination

      Francois Rheault, Kurt Schilling, Alex Valcourt-Caron, Antoine Th{\'e}berge, Charles Poirier, Gabrielle Grenier, Guido Guberman, John Begnoche, Jon Legarreta, Leon Y, "Tractostorm 2: Optimizing tractography dissection reproducibility with segmentation protocol dissemination." Human brain mapping, 2022.

    • The do's and don'ts of reinforcement learning for tractography

      Antoine Theberge, Christian Desrosiers, Pierre-marc Jodoin, Maxime Descoteaux, "The do&apos;s and don&apos;ts of reinforcement learning for tractography." In the proceedings of Medical Imaging with Deep Learning, 2022.

    • Where do streamlines come from? Seeding strategies impact on streamline distribution

      Manon Edde, Etienne St-Onge, Antoine Th{\'e}berge, Guillaume Theaud, Emmanuelle Renauld, Maxime Descoteaux, "Where do streamlines come from? Seeding strategies impact on streamline distribution." In the proceedings of International Society for Magnetic Resonance Imaging in Medicine, 2021.

    • Track-to-Learn: A general framework for tractography with deep reinforcement learning

      Antoine Th{\'e}berge, Christian Desrosiers, Maxime Descoteaux, Pierre-Marc Jodoin, "Track-to-Learn: A general framework for tractography with deep reinforcement learning." Medical Image Analysis, 2021.

    • Manifold-aware Synthesis of High-resolution Diffusion from Structural Imaging

      Benoit Anctil-Robitaille, Antoine Th{\'e}berge, Pierre-Marc Jodoin, Maxime Descoteaux, Christian Desrosiers, Herv{\'e} Lombaert, "Manifold-aware Synthesis of High-resolution Diffusion from Structural Imaging." arXiv preprint arXiv:2108.04135, 2021.

    • Track-To-Learn: A general framework for tractography with deep reinforcement learning

      Antoine Th{\'e}berge, Christian Desrosiers, Maxime Descoteaux, Pierre-Marc Jodoin, "Track-To-Learn: A general framework for tractography with deep reinforcement learning." bioRxiv, 2020.
